sub_topic: Predicting the dipole moment of a molecule
message_1: What is the dipole moment of carbon dioxide (CO2)?
message_2:
Carbon dioxide (CO2) is a linear molecule with a carbon atom in the center and two oxygen atoms on either side. The carbon-oxygen bonds in CO2 are polar due to the difference in electronegativity between carbon and oxygen atoms. However, due to the linear geometry of the molecule, the dipole moments of the two carbon-oxygen bonds are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction. As a result, they cancel each other out.

Therefore, the net dipole moment of carbon dioxide (CO2) is 0 Debye.
